The whole management team at NTT data value your opinion , I have never worked for a company where by you can talk to the senior management team so openly and feel like your opinion/suggestions matter .

Work Benefits should never be overlooked with multiple options... 

Office environment is nice no hidden management offices all open plan..
cons:

... Caramel syrup should be replaced more often ?

job_title: Senior Integration Specialist in Reading, PA
pros: I received my paycheck on time.
cons:
A company that purchased Dell Services for a bigger foothold in the US but with no interest in developing talent here. They have also bought other companies in the US over the last 2 years and it will be interesting to see if they also decide to dissolve parts of those and just move jobs to Romania, Mexico, and India. With no sales team to back our group, they just let clients leave and did not move to fill in the spots. After a time they told clients that they need to find new hosting and began laying off people from the teams that supported them. Most clients were happy to go since employees looked for work elsewhere and left or were laid off. 

Middle Management does not know what is happening from day to day and has not active contact with their workers. They make people team leads who have the most face time with the managers but also have no real idea what is going on. I myself only had contact with my manager one time in a year.

Benefits are below industry standard but NTT Data employees who were not part of a purchase think their benefits are good because they cut the benefits of the companies they bought and split the difference.

Bonuses for engineers and anyone below middle management are nonexistent and so are pay increases.

The company direction is very fragmented. What gets said at the global company meetings seems very distant from the day-to-day.

If this is your first chance at working for an enterprise company of this size. Take the job and in a year start looking for something better with your new-found experience.

For anyone with experience, I suggest moving on unless you desperately need a job.

Diversity and inclusion gets talked about a lot but is nonexistent and is a boys club.

Culture and values do not exist. It is about keeping your job and trying to figure out which direction the company is going at any given time.

Senior management I think has no clue what is going on below it or does not care. Rome is burning and they fiddle away

Work-life balance is ok but that is only because I was grandfathered into remote work. Once the pandemic is over good luck getting that perk. They were steadfast in not allowing people to work remotely before and once they can I am sure they will begin calling back people who can do their jobs from home.
